subsection.name: Add Dependencies in Repository Web Application
subsection.p: Add the following dependencies into your Hippo Repository Web Application (e.g. '/cms').

Note: insert the dependencies below the org.onehippo.cms7:hippo-cms-dependencies to avoid org.apache.jackrabbit:jackrabbit-jcr-server pulling in commons-codec:commons-codec:jar:1.2 whilst the CMS needs version commons-codec 1.4.

div.source:
<properties> <!-- SNIP -->
<forge.hipporepojcrdav.version>0.01.00</forge.hipporepojcrdav.version> <jackrabbit.version>2.2.12-h2</jackrabbit.version> </properties>
<repositories> <!-- SNIP -->
<repository> <id>hipporepojcrdav-maven-repo</id> <name>Hippo Repository JCR/WebDAV Support Maven 2 Repository</name> <url>http://forge.onehippo.org/svn/hipporepojcrdav/maven2/</url> </repository> </repositories>
<dependencies> <!-- SNIP -->
<dependency> <groupId>org.apache.jackrabbit</groupId> <artifactId>jackrabbit-jcr-server</artifactId> <version>${jackrabbit.version}</version> </dependency>
<dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.hipporepojcrdav</groupId> <artifactId>hipporepojcrdav-servlet</artifactId> <version>${forge.hipporepojcrdav.version}</version> </dependency> </dependencies>

subsection.name: Add Servlet in Repository Web Application
subsection.p: Add the following servlet configurations into your Hippo Repository Web Application (e.g. '/cms').

div.source:
<!-- SNIP -->
<!-- JCR over WebDAV Server Servlet: WARNING: This servlet gives accesses to repository through WebDAV with Basic Authentication by default. So, you may want to put more secured access controls on the communication channel where needed. --> <servlet> <servlet-name>JCRWebdavServer</servlet-name> <servlet-class>org.onehippo.forge.repository.server.remoting.davex.JcrRemotingServlet</servlet-class> <init-param> <param-name>repository-address</param-name> <param-value>vm://</param-value> </init-param> <init-param> <param-name>missing-auth-mapping</param-name> <param-value></param-value> </init-param> <init-param> <param-name>authenticate-header</param-name> <param-value>Basic realm="Hippo Repository Webdav Server"</param-value> </init-param> <init-param> <param-name>resource-path-prefix</param-name> <param-value>/server</param-value> </init-param> <load-on-startup>6</load-on-startup> </servlet>
<!-- SNIP -->
<!-- JCR over WebDAV Server Servlet Mapping: --> <servlet-mapping> <servlet-name>JCRWebdavServer</servlet-name> <url-pattern>/server/*</url-pattern> </servlet-mapping>
<!-- SNIP -->

subsection.name: How to Know It's Working?
subsection.p: You can test if it is working by running command lines like the following example.
If successful, you get the following result:

div.source: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <sv:node xmlns:sv="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/sv/1.0" sv:name="jcr:root"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>rep:root</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:mixinTypes" sv:type="Name" sv:multiple="true"> <sv:value>mix:referenceable</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:uuid" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>cafebabe-cafe-babe-cafe-babecafebabe</sv:value> </sv:property> </sv:node>
